1{-# OPTIONS_GHC -Wall #-}
2
3-- | Term types and related functions.
4
5module Koshucode.Baala.Syntax.Symbol.Term
6  ( -- * Term
7    Term, term,
8
9    -- * Term name
10    TermName, TermPath, SignedTermName,
11    showTermName, showTermPath,
12
13    -- * Term name tuple
14    TermName2, TermName3,
15    TermName4, TermName5, TermName6,
16
17    -- * Present or new term
18    termP, termN, --termPN,
19    termsP, termsN, termsPN,
20  ) where
21
22import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Overture   as O
23
24
25-- ----------------------  Term
26
27-- | Term type: pair of term name and content.
28type Term c = (TermName, c)
29
30-- | Create term.
31--
32--   >>> term "size" 10 :: Term Int
33--   ("size", 10)
34--
35term :: TermName -> c -> Term c
36term n c = (n, c)
37
38
39-- ----------------------  Term name
40
41-- | Name of term, e.g., @\"size\"@ for the term name @\/size@.
42type TermName = String
43
44-- | Path of term names, e.g., term name @\/r\/x@
45--   is correspond to path @[\"r\", \"x\"]@.
46type TermPath = [TermName]
47
48-- | Term name with plus-minus sign, e.g., @+\/size@, @-\/size@, or @\/size@.
49type SignedTermName = (Ordering, TermName)
50
51-- | Encode term name into string.
52--
53--   >>> showTermName "size"
54--   "/size"
55--
56showTermName :: TermName -> String
57showTermName n = '/' : n
58
59-- | Encode term path into string.
60--
61--   >>> showTermPath ["r", "x"]
62--   "/r/x"
63--
64showTermPath :: TermPath -> String
65showTermPath = concatMap showTermName
66
67
68-- ----------------------  Term name tuple
69
70-- | Tuple of 2 term names.
71type TermName2 = (TermName, TermName)
72
73-- | Tuple of 3 term names.
74type TermName3 = (TermName, TermName, TermName)
75
76-- | Tuple of 4 term names.
77type TermName4 = (TermName, TermName, TermName, TermName)
78
79-- | Tuple of 5 term names.
80type TermName5 = (TermName, TermName, TermName, TermName, TermName)
81
82-- | Tuple of 6 term names.
83type TermName6 = (TermName, TermName, TermName, TermName, TermName, TermName)
84
85
86-- ----------------------  Present or new term
87
88-- | Check present term.
89--
90--   >>> termP 2
91--   True
92--
93--   >>> termP 0
94--   True
95--
96--   >>> termP (-1)
97--   False
98--
99termP :: O.Test Int
100termP = (>= 0)
101
102-- | Check new term.
103termN :: O.Test Int
104termN = (< 0)
105
106-- Check present and new terms.
107--termPN :: O.Test2 Int Int
108--termPN p n = termP p && termN n
109
110-- | Check all terms are present.
111termsP :: O.Test [Int]
112termsP = all termP
113
114-- | Check all terms are new.
115termsN :: O.Test [Int]
116termsN = all termN
117
118-- | Check present terms and new terms.
119termsPN :: O.Test2 [Int] [Int]
120termsPN ps ns = termsP ps && termsN ns
121
